intro: Gordonia tiantangensis, commonly known as the Tiantang bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, and it produces small, clustered fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
